title: Windows revelation not so obvious to me - may be for someone else?
body:
might be something very obvious to  Windows gurus but here you go:

```shell
(Pdb) event_loop.run_until_complete(run_async_cmd(event_loop, 'git annex version --raw' , protocol, stdin, protocol_kwargs=kwargs, cwd=cwd, env=env))
{'stdout': '8.20201008-g577af1b', 'stderr': '', 'code': 0}
(Pdb) event_loop.run_until_complete(run_async_cmd(event_loop, ['git', 'annex', 'version', '--raw'], protocol, stdin, protocol_kwargs=kwargs, cwd=cwd, env=env))
{'stdout': '', 'stderr': "git: 'annex' is not a git command. See 'git --help'.\n", 'code': 1}
```

the same with old `Runner` (directly here):
```
(Pdb) Runner().run('git annex version', env=env2)
('git-annex version: 8.20201008-g577af1b\r\nbuild flags:.....', '')
(Pdb) Runner().run(['git', 'annex', 'version'], env=env2)
*** datalad.support.exceptions.CommandError: CommandError: '"git" "annex" "version"' failed with exitcode 1 [err: 'git: 'annex' is not a git command. See 'git --help'.']
```

so `env` (so PATH) is the same, but when it is explicitly ran through shell of some kind on windows - something happens to PATH as it gets to git, or may be a different git is ran, dunno

In my "explorations" I apparently did not follow http://handbook.datalad.org/en/latest/intro/installation.html#windows-10 "to the word", which do not tell to install git natively systemwide, but rather within conda, and then git-annex INTO conda env.
I followed git-annex installation instructions (install git, then git-annex into git) and then created a new conda environment into which I `conda install -c conda-forge --only-deps datalad` and then `pip install -e .` within datalad git .  But if `git` does see `git-annex` whenever I run in a normal windows shell, or in conda shell outside of `datalad` environment; it does not see it inside `datalad` environment and that seems to relate to PATH overloads done by conda (if I prepend `C:\Program Files\Git\cmd` to PATH - it finds it in that anaconda shell).  So I was exploring us tuning up PATH for running git so it sees git-annex. But it somehow "was not in effect" - until I dug deep enough into this particular difference which makes little sense to me.

Now, I guess, I need to uninstall git, git-annex, and miniconda altogether and try from start with sticking git-annex into miniconda environment/installation to get into "common denominator" of how annex should be installed for datalad on windows ;-)  Let's see what that brings me
